Reported to Senate from the Committee on Governmental Affairs with amendment, S. Rept. 95-403.
Placed on calendar in Senate under Measures Cleared to be Considered by Unanimous Consent.

actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.
Reported to House from the Committee on Post Office and Civil Service with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1496.
Measure called up by consent calendar in House.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: An Act to clarify the status of certain legislative and judicial officers under the provisions of title 5, United States Code, relating to annual and sick leave, and for other purposes.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Post Office and Civil Service with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1496) Excepts from the annual and sick leave provisions of law any officer in the legislative or judicial branch who is appointed by the President. Provides that any annual or sick leave standing to the credit of an individual at the time such individual is excepted from certain annual and sick leave provisions of law, shall be added to the employee's total service for the purpose of computing his retirement anniuty. Provides that this Act shall take effect on the first day of the first applicable pay period which begins on or after the date of enactment. Stipulates that such retirement credit shall apply only with respect to employees who retire or die on or after the date of enactment.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 5, U.S.C.
An Act to clarify the status of certain legislative and judicial officers under the provisions of title 5, United States Code, relating to annual and sick leave, and for other purposes.
